intro: Sticherus paulistanus var. pseudopubescens, commonly known as the Brazilian fern, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are often covered in a dense, hairy layer, contributing to its varietal name. The leaves are usually bi- to tri-pinnate, with a soft, leathery texture and a pale green to bluish-gray color.
